data.title: Downtown MRT Station
data.meta_description: Downtown MRT Station (DT17) is the name for an underground Mass Rapid Transit station on the Downtown Line Stage 1 in Singapore. It connects the southern part of Marina Bay where developments such as The Sail @ Marina Bay and the Marina Bay Financial Centre lie to the current CBD. The station...
data.text:
Downtown MRT Station (DT17) is the name for an underground Mass Rapid Transit station on the Downtown Line Stage 1 in Singapore. It connects the southern part of Marina Bay where developments such as The Sail @ Marina Bay and the Marina Bay Financial Centre lie to the current CBD. The station will serve future commercial developments within the Marina Bay vicinity, and is located under Central Boulevard.

Art in Transit[]

Illustrations on the walls of the station titled, "Leaves" by Jason Lim shows a connection of dense cell network of bamboo leaves and the business and financial services in the vicinity.

History[]

During the Circle Line Stage 1 planning, the Circle Line extension was planned to terminate at Chinatown and was used by both Circle Line and Eastern Region Line all the way until 2007. Now the section between Bayfront and Chinatown is used by the current Downtown Line Stage 1.

Downtown Line Stage 1 (DTL1) Contract 907 for the construction and completion of the Downtown Station and tunnels was awarded to Japanese company Taisei Corporation for approximately S$230.3 million in Jan 2008. The working name for Downtown station was Landmark Station.

Platforms[]

Downtown MRT station has two platforms in a side platform arrangement, similar to Telok Ayer and Chinatown stations further down the line, with both platforms utilized for trains travelling in either direction. Full-height Platform screen doors isolate the air-conditioned station from the tunnel environment, enhancing commuter safety and station comfort. A set of escalators, stairs and lifts connect to the concourse above, because of the insufficient working space at Central Boulevard and Cross Street. The station houses a small number of retail outlets, while the adjacent Marina Bay Link Mall contains many more retail outlets.

Concourse[]

Originally it was supposed to have the faregates linked to the platform level but however it was scrapped.

Passenger Usage Patterns[]

As a station serving the Downtown Core and surrounded by dense mixed-use developments, Downtown station encounters moderate to heavy demand levels during the peak hours as office workers commute to and from work and home. These include:

Route Destinations Downtown Line (Eastbound) EWL - Kallang & Bedok (change at Bugis)

NSL - Woodlands (change at Newton)

NEL - Punggol (change at Little India)

DTL - Bukit Panjang & Bukit Timah Downtown Line (Westbound) NEL - Sengkang (change at Chinatown)

DTL - Geylang Bahru & Tampines

SKLRT - Rumbia (change at Chinatown)

Station layout[]

L1 Street Level Bus stops, Taxi stand, pick-up/drop-off point B1 Concourse Faregates, Ticketing Machines, Station Control B2 Side platform, doors will open on the left Platform 1 Downtown Line towards DT35 Expo via DT18 Telok Ayer (→) Platform 2 Downtown Line towards DT1 Bukit Panjang via DT16 Bayfront (←) Side platform, doors will open on the left B3 North South Line North South Line tracks (restricted access).

Exits[]

A: Hong Leong Building, Marina Boulevard, NTUC Centre, One Raffles Quay, The Lawn @ Marina Bay, The Sail @ Marina Bay, UOE Bayfront

B: Marina Bay Link Mall (Level B1)

C: Marina Bay Financial Centre (via Marina Bay Link Mall)

D: One Raffles Quay

E: Central Boulevard, Asia Square Towers 1 and 2, CPF Building, Lau Pa Sat Festival Market, Marina Bay Police Station, SGX Centre, Shenton House, Sofitel SO Singapore, UOE Downtown, Westin Hotel

F: Marina Bay Suites, The Sail @ Marina Bay
